member.name: T:Bam.Net.Encryption.Crypto
member.summary: This class was taken verbatim from the highest ranked answer from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/202011/encrypt-and-decrypt-a-string although it wasn't marked as the answer it appears to be sufficient

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Crypto.EncryptStringAES(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encrypt the given string using AES. The string can be decrypted using DecryptStringAES(). The sharedSecret parameters must match.
member.param: The text to encrypt.
A password used to generate a key for encryption.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Crypto.DecryptStringAES(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Decrypt the given string. Assumes the string was encrypted using EncryptStringAES(), using an identical sharedSecret.
member.param: The text to decrypt.
A password used to generate a key for decryption.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Encrypted.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: The plain text data to be encrypted
A plaintext value to derive a key from
A plain text vlaue to derive the initialization vector from

member.name: T:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault
member.summary: An encrypted key value store used to prevent casual access to sensitive data like passwords. Encrypted data is stored in a sqlite file by default or a Database you specify

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.GetUniqueFilter
member.summary: Gets a query filter that should uniquely identify the current instance. The default implementation compares the Id/key field to the current instance's.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.LoadAll(Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Return every record in the Vault table.
member.param: The database to load from or null

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.BatchAll(System.Int32,System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault}},Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Process all records in batches of the specified size

member.summary: Process results of a query in batches of the specified size

member.summary: Execute a query and return the results.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.Where(Bam.Net.Data.Qi.QiQuery,Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: This method is intended to respond to client side Qi queries. Use of this method from .Net should be avoided in favor of one of the methods that take a delegate of type WhereDelegate<VaultColumns>.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.GetOneWhere(Bam.Net.Data.QueryFilter,Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Get one entry matching the specified filter. If none exists one will be created; success will depend on the nullability of the specified columns.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.OneWhere(Bam.Net.Data.QueryFilter,Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Execute a query that should return only one result. If more than one result is returned a MultipleEntriesFoundException will be thrown.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.GetOneWhere(Bam.Net.Data.WhereDelegate{Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultColumns},Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Get one entry matching the specified filter. If none exists one will be created; success will depend on the nullability of the specified columns.

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.OneWhere(Bam.Net.Data.WhereDelegate{Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultColumns},Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Execute a query that should return only one result. If more than one result is returned a MultipleEntriesFoundException will be thrown. This method is most commonly used to retrieve a single Vault instance by its Id/Key value
member.param: A WhereDelegate that recieves a VaultColumns and returns a IQueryFilter which is the result of any comparisons between VaultColumns and other values

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.FirstOneWhere(Bam.Net.Data.WhereDelegate{Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultColumns},Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Execute a query and return the first result. This method will issue a sql TOP clause so only the specified number of values will be returned.
member.param: A WhereDelegate that recieves a VaultColumns and returns a IQueryFilter which is the result of any comparisons between VaultColumns and other values

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.FirstOneWhere(Bam.Net.Data.WhereDelegate{Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultColumns},Bam.Net.Data.OrderBy{Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultColumns},Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Execute a query and return the first result. This method will issue a sql TOP clause so only the specified number of values will be returned.

member.summary: Shortcut for Top(1, where, orderBy, database)
member.param: A WhereDelegate that recieves a VaultColumns and returns a IQueryFilter which is the result of any comparisons between VaultColumns and other values

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.Retrieve(System.String)
member.summary: Get the vault with the specified name

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.Retrieve(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the Vault with the specified name using the specified password to create it if it doesn't exist

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.Retrieve(Bam.Net.Data.Database,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get a Vault from the specified database with the specified name using the specified password to create it if it doesn't exist. Will return null if password is not specified and the vault doesn't exist in the specified database

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.Create(System.IO.FileInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Create a vault in the specified file by the specified name. If the vault already exists in the specified file the existing vault will be returned

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.Vault.Create(Bam.Net.Data.Database,System.String,System.String,Bam.Net.Encryption.RsaKeyLength)
member.summary: Create a Vault in the specified database by the specified name using the specified password to create it if it doesn't exist

member.name: M:Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultKey.Top(System.Int32,Bam.Net.Data.WhereDelegate{Bam.Net.Encryption.VaultKeyColumns},Bam.Net.Data.Database)
member.summary: Execute a query and return the specified number of values. This method will issue a sql TOP clause so only the specified number of values will be returned.
member.param: The number of values to return. This value is used in the sql query so no more than this number of values will be returned by the database.
A WhereDelegate that recieves a VaultKeyColumns and returns a IQueryFilter which is the result of any comparisons between VaultKeyColumns and other values
